meta.name: Starting Strength
meta.author: Mark Rippetoe
meta.source: Starting Strength Basic Barbell Training, 3rd Edition

info.overview: Starting Strength is a linear progression based program for novice lifters
info.scheduling: Alternate workouts A and B with at least 1 rest day between training sessions
info.progressing: Increase the weight on each excersise (except chinups) by 5 lbs. per workout. If you're young and recovering well, you may increase squats and deadlifts by 10 lbs. when starting out As lifts like the overhead press start to stall, you may want to increase the weight by 2.5 lbs. per session.

Workout A: 3 sets of Chinups/Pullups, do as many as possible without going to failure. Chinups are generally preferred as they involve more muscle mass than pullups
Workout B: 3 sets of Chinups/Pullups, do as many as possible without going to failure. Chinups are generally preferred as they involve more muscle mass than pullups

meta.name: The Texas Method
meta.author: Mark Rippetoe
meta.source: Practical Programming for Strength Training, 3rd Edition

info.overview: The Texas Method is an intermediate program for dedicated lifters practicing optimal recovery techniques
info.scheduling: Do volume workout, recovery workout, and heavy workout in order with 1-2 rest days in between each workout session
info.progressing: Do volume workout sets with weight at 90% of the heavy day. Recovery workout weights should be roughly 80-90% of volume day. Increase the work weight on heavy day by 5 lbs. each week.

meta.name: The Texas Method for Powerlifting
meta.author: Mark Rippetoe
meta.source: Practical Programming for Strength Training, 3rd Edition

info.overview: The Texas Method for Powerlifting is a variant of The Texas Method designed for intermediate trainees focused on Powerlifting
info.scheduling: Do volume workout, recovery workout, and mock meet workout in order with 1-2 rest days in between each workout session
info.progressing: Do volume workout sets with weight at 70% of mock meet day singles. Recovery workout weights should be roughly 80-90% of volume day. Increase the work weight on mock meet day by 5 lbs. each week. Mock meet weight should be about 90% of actual 1 rep max for the lift.

info.overview: The Recommended Routine is the /r/bodyweightfitness community's novice linear progression program. The program here is simplified to focus on the core strength development work.
info.scheduling: Do full body workout with at least 1 rest day between workouts
info.progressing: Do each progression for 5-8 reps, adding 1 rep per set each session. When you reach 8 reps, move to a harder progression and do 5 reps. Sometimes, moving down to 3 reps may be necessary.

Workout A: 3 sets of 5-8 Hip Hinge/Lower Back Progression

meta.name: Barbell Medicine Beginner Prescription
meta.author: Dr. Jordan Feigenbaum and Dr. Austin Baraki

info.overview: The Beginner Prescription is a novice program that introduces strength and conditioning.
info.scheduling: Do full body workout with at least 1 rest day between workouts, occasional back-to-back days are OK if needed
info.progressing: Weight selection will gradually increase based on RPE (rate of perceived exertion) prescribed
